title: The Trial of the System
outcome: Citizens hold open truth commissions, reviewing Halden’s secret system logs and testimonies from returnees and Council members. The BCI is judged irredeemable and systematically dismantled. Stenograd slowly re-learns communal democracy, governed by public assembly and handwritten records.

events.description: Citizen assemblies establish public truth commissions in city squares, inviting anyone—including Council members and returnees—to testify about BCI abuses and Council actions.
Oksana Lintz releases Halden’s hidden BCI logs showing Council efforts to increase detentions. Citizens are shocked by Halden’s recorded interventions to limit Council excesses.
After weeks of emotional testimonies and debate, the public commission announces its verdict: the BCI is fundamentally unjust and must be dismantled. Celebrations and anxious debates break out.
Teams of volunteers and dismissed BCI staff begin meticulously archiving and disabling system components. Essential services transition to manual operation as assemblies coordinate daily needs.

A fledgling city council forms by open ballot, coordinating food, transport, and security. Stenograd experiences both uncertainty and hope as communal decision-making returns for the first time since BCI’s full rollout.
